entry.string: Administration - XML-RPC
Overview
What is it?
XML-RPC is a Xaraya Utility Module.

The XML-RPC server module is responsible for exposing certain procedure calls using XML as the transport format. Each command is send as an http request in a specified format. The XML-RPC server answers to that call with a properly formatted XML-RPC response.
The XML-RPC server can be extended by defining API modules to extend the functionality offered by Xaraya over XML-RPC. The XML-RPC standard is defined at
An XML-RPC enabled service can be used to
use Xaraya remotely
let Xaraya interoperate with other applications or other Xaraya installations
use desktop clients to manage or work with Xaraya

The most well known usage of XML-RPC are the API's used for blogging (see below). These API's are used in Xaraya to write articles on a Xaraya site, using a desktop client. Examples of blog clients include:
The XML-RPC server can be configured to serve multiple APIs The currently supported APIs are
use Xaraya as a Blogging site installation. (Note: the blogger.setTemplate and blogger.getTemplate functions are currently not implemented)
used to validate XML-RPC conformance
Get information about the XML-RPC server and its methods

An extension of the Blogger API which adds more rich support for the message content and the ability to upload media objects (Note: the categories support in this API is limited and the metaWeblog.newMediaObject method hasn't been implemented yet.
